_exec_summary.SummaryText:
(a) Release prevention and emergency response policies
Pfizer Inc. located in Lititz Pennsylvania is a manufacturer and distributor of consumer healthcare products.  The site has a manufacturing facility and handles ingredients that are used in the manufacture of drug products.  The site has a manufacturing facility and handles ingredients that are used in the manufacture of drug products.  The Micatin product requiring a RMP submission is not manufactured at the Lititz site.  Micatin is received at the Lititz Logistics Center for warheousing and distribution to customers. The Micatin product is the first material handled at the Lititz containing a Risk Management Planning (RMP) reportable material.

The Pfizer Lititz site is an ISO 14001 certified facility. Pfizer Lititz is the first pharmaceutical pharmaceutical plant in the US to be ISO 14001 certified achieving its' certification in 1997. It is certified by Lloyd's Register Quality Assurance(LRQA). As such, the sire receives extensive surveillance audits of its' managements system which includes emergency preparedness and response. The Pfizer Lititz facility is a Charter Member of the EPA national Environmental Performance Track and most recently received the 2003 EPA Parformance Track Award for the Most Outstanding Performance.

Pfizer Lititz's environmental policy is follows:
Pfizer Lititz colleagues are committed to being environmentally responsible corporate citizens. This will entail:
Being proactive in our efforts to improve production processes to eliminate waste.
Seeking out and considering current technologies in environmentally preferred packaging, reusable material handling and recycling systems, waste water discharge reduction, solid waste handling and disposal, and hazardous materials handling and storage.
Through the use of these technologies and systems, we will continue to move forward toward our objective of zero waste discharge through continual improvement.
Pfizer is committed to complying w

ith relevant environmental legislation, regulations and corporate environmental policy.
Pfizer is committed to actively supporting public outreach initiatives and programs.

Pfizer Lititz's safety policy is as follows:
* Pfizer is committed to conducting our operations safely and to prevent loss, whether it be injury/illness to colleagues, damage to property or interruption of the business process.
* It is our goal to provide a safe and healthy workplace for all colleagues, visitors and contractors.
* We are committed to continual improvement of our safety and health performance.
* We will strive to be proactive in our efforts to improve production processes.  The elimination of potential safety and health risks will be a fundamental consideration in the design and operation of our processes.
* We will systematically identify and evaluate potential hazards and move forward toward our goal of a zero accident workplace.
* We are committed to maintaining a comprehensive safety & health management system. We will periodically monitor performance and initiate actions necessary to correct identified deficiencies.
* Pfizer is committed to complying with all relevant safety & health legislation, regulations and corporate policy.
* Pfizer recognizes that for safety to succeed there must be a cooperative effort dependent on the total commitment of all. The Pfizer Management Team earnestly solicits each colleague's assistance as a member of our accident prevention team to help in the recognition and elimination of hazards within the facility.
Observed hazardous conditions or practices should be corrected and / or reported promptly to supervision.
Every colleague has the responsibility to work safely and to adhere to applicable job procedures.

(b) Stationary source and regulated substances handled:
The Pfizer Lititz facility is a Synthetic Minor air source under Title V and has a Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection issued air permit No. 36-05007. The facility a

lso is covered under the Clean water Act 40CFR 112 for pharmaceutical mixing and compounding. The site has an EPA wastwater permit No. PAP 120320. The site is a large quantity generator of hazardous waste and has an EPA ID Number PAD003008943.

The Pfizer Lititz site is also a PSM site for alcohol.

The Pfizer Lititz Logistic Center is a regional center for the distribution of consumer healthcare products. A single product Micatin¿, an aerosol consumer product stored in the Logistic center, is covered by RMP requirements. The propellant in Micatin is an 80/20 mixture of isobutane and propane. Warehouse storage of Micatin is the sole RMP applicable processes at the facility.  Storage is in cardboard shipping boxes containing four ounce steel cans on pallets.

(c) The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:
While the chances of a worst-case situation actually occurring are incalculable, such a scenario by definition is within the realm of possibility. That is why Pfizer's first emergency management priority is accidental release prevention.

Worst case Release Scenarios were modeled using EPA's RMP*Comp v1.07.

To protect the facility's employees, the surrounding community, and the environment; Pifzer's operations adhere to the accident-prevention elements required under the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) Standard and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Risk Management Program (RMP) Rule. The facility's PSM procedures and policies address all of the required elements of the PSM Standard and RMP Rule Prevention Program 1 elements.

(d) General accidental release prevention and chemical specific prevention steps
The facility is accessed control via key card and manned guard station.  Sprinklers and fire extinguishers are provided. The site has an on-site Emergency Response Team. GE Gaps conducts annual fire safety inspections of the facility.

(e) Five y

ear accident history
No reportable incidents have occurred at the facility in the past five years.

(h) Emergency response program
The facility has an extensive Consolidated Emergency Response Plan that includes the requirements under the Superfund Amendments and Reauthorization Act (SARA) and regularly communicates with the Lititz and Lancaster Emergency Management Agency (LEMA) and local emergency-response organizations on matters pertaining to emergency preparedness and chemical storage.. The site has a Emergency Response Team (ERT) trained to 24 hr HAZWOPER standards. ERT members are also trained in medical response procedures. Annual drills are conducted with local emergency management agencies and the facility conducts 6 in-house training drills each year for the site ERT. The drils are designed to train for response to materials found and handled on site. The Micatin product is included in the emergency response plans.

(g) Planned changes
None
